metadata.synopsis: This is the main hag dialogue. In it, you can ask about Mayrina (who is present) or make a deal to have your parasite removed. If you keep asking about Mayrina (twice), the hag will be furious and vanish Mayrina away while she deals with the 'busybody' - the player.If you agree to the tadpole deal, you must give up an eye (in the transformed dialogue).

20.text: I don't want a crumb left on that plate, girl.
20.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Standing, Mayrina sets a plate down on the table, pie still on itNodeContext: Cheerful granny voice - you're merrily ordering Mayrina about

97.speaker: Mayrina
97.text: Auntie Ethel, please. One more bite and this pie is gonna come back up to say hello.
97.context: NodeContext: Trying to stick up for yourself but a touch of fear in your voice. You know she's a hag and you should do as she says but you feel nauseous and sick.

189.text: Don't make me get the wooden spoon. You're eating for two, so get to it!
189.context: InternalNodeContext: Next node - sees player.NodeContext: A cheery rhythm to your voice even at the steel to your tone. You will be obeyed.

12.text: You'd best have one hells of an apology for me, petal.
12.context: NodeContext: Cold and annoyed. There's not a doubt in your mind that they player must be here to apologise (spoiler, they're not)

281.speaker: Player
281.text: I'm sorry. I shouldn't have raised a hand against you.

68.speaker: Player
68.text: I'm sorry. I should have stepped in.

53.speaker: Player
53.text: You'll get no apology from me, hag.

179.text: Hah! Oh, I do like the mouthy ones.
179.context: NodeContext: Player has refused to apologise. You laugh in surprise and are actually delighted - you love a challenge.

157.speaker: Player
157.text: You must have mistaken me for someone else.

124.text: I don't think I did, dearie. And frankly you're thick for saying so.
124.context: NodeContext: Player has said you have the wrong person. You're annoyed - very annoyed - you don't like the insinuation that you're stupid.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: You think you scare me? Please. I've met far worse than you in my time.

168.speaker: Player
168.text: My people took orders once. I'm not doing it again.

282.text: But you'd look so good on your knees.
282.context: NodeContext: Player has refused to take orders. You smile - enjoying the chance to be nasty and tease,

185.text: Hah! Bet you wouldn't say that to Vlaakith. You're nothing but a scared child masquerading as a warrior.
185.context: NodeContext: Player, a gith, has said they apologise to no one. You laugh - you know exactly who they're terrified and what their weapoints are, and you twist the knife, enjoying yourself.

2.speaker: Player
2.text: Apology? I could crush you like a bird's nest!

99.text: How shocking: another barbarian with all brawn and no brains.
99.context: NodeContext: Player has refused to apologise. You sigh as you twist the knife.

177.speaker: Player
177.text: I appear to have forgotten my apology. How about a poem instead?

172.text: Another bard who thinks humour is the same as talent - cute.
172.context: NodeContext: Player has refused to apologise. You sigh as you twist the knife.

52.speaker: Player
52.text: I won't apologise to such a wicked creature.

204.text: Aw, is it hard to see from up there on your high horse? If only you knew some of the horrors your pretty little gods had committed...

275.speaker: Player
275.text: You don't scare me. I serve someone far more terrifying.

280.speaker: Lae'zel
280.text: Bhaal, right? He'll not bother us. He's far too busy using blood as fingerpaint and taking credit for other people's kills.
280.context: NodeContext: You're purposefully poking fun at the player. Smiling as you twist the knife a little.

186.speaker: Lae'zel
186.text: Bane, right? The laziest tyrant of all. He sits on his backside while you lot run around doing all the work. Do you wipe his arse, too? Hah!
186.context: NodeContext: You're purposefully poking fun at the player. Smiling as you twist the knife a little.

83.text: Myrkul? Pretty rubbish god of death, if you ask me. You're just an adorable little misery guts though.
83.context: NodeContext: You're purposefully poking fun at the player. Smiling as you twist the knife a little.

126.text: You know, I was gonna give you a swift kick up the arse and show you the door...
126.context: NodeContext: Smile as if you've just decided

184.text: ...but I think you and I could have a bit of fun together.
184.context: NodeContext: Flirty but in an extremely threatening way.

115.text: Gods, grant me patience... Eat up, Mayrina! I won't say it again.
115.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Mayrina looks up, at Ethel then down at her plate, nearly in tearsNodeContext: Frowning as you look over Mayrina - her plater is still full. You roll your eyes, looking frustrated as you sigh. Sharp admonishment for the second line. You don't sound particularly kind here,

105.speaker: Player
105.text: That's Mayrina? I have some bad news for her.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: That's Mayrina? I have some bad news for her.

109.text: Keep that hole under your nose shut. Or things will get messy.
109.context: NodeContext: You can believe the player has just shot their mouth of. Near hissed at the player - they're going to ruin everything.

149.speaker: Lae'zel
149.text: Don't bother. You'd only subject us to her inevitable wailing.

222.speaker: Shadowheart
222.text: You know what that sounds like to me? Leverage.

74.speaker: Karlach
74.text: Pfft. That hag doesn't tell us what to do.

54.speaker: Mayrina
54.text: What is it? What's going on?
54.context: NodeContext: You've just heard your name and something about 'bad news'. You're already shaken.

228.speaker: Player
228.text: I fought your brothers, but I didn't kill them - I only knocked them out.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: Nothing. I mistook you for someone else.

21.text: You just have one of those faces, Mayrina. So bland and forgettable.
21.context: NodeContext: Player has done as you asked and chosen not to tell Mayrina. You're relieved and can't resist poking fun at Mayrina.

62.context: NodeContext: Direct at player - you're pleased they've done what they were told.

236.speaker: Lae'zel
236.text: Now, about what you told me in the grove - your little wriggler problem.
236.context: NodeContext: Cheerful granny persona - you're here to help and make it all better

220.text: It must be an awful thing to have hanging over your head - or in it, rather. Let me take care of that for you.

213.speaker: Player
213.text: If you have this power, why didn't you remove it at the grove?

29.text: Prying eyes. I didn't need those druids in my business.
29.context: NodeContext: With a shrug - like that settles that

19.speaker: Player
19.text: I'm not sure I want your help anymore.

266.speaker: Lae'zel
266.text: Now, about that wriggler of yours.

191.text: Now, I can tell you're in dire need of help, petal.

4.text: That wriggler swimming in your brain juice is a bit of an inconvenience, isn't it?

79.speaker: Player
79.text: Are you saying you can remove it?

70.text: You don't need to bear the brunt of this alone, precious. Auntie Ethel is here for you.
70.context: NodeContext: Caring and loving grandmother persona here, offering to do whatever you can for the player

271.text: Because you stink. And I know the stench of mind flayer anywhere.

32.text: No, but it is yours. And if I were you, I would be very concerned.
32.context: NodeContext: Player has said it's none of your concern. You shoot back with this, really emphasising how worried your'd be in their shoes.

174.speaker: Player
174.text: Don't change the subject. Why is that woman really here?

194.text: I told you - the girl is none of your business. Keep that hole under your nose shut.
194.context: NodeContext: You're not used to being disobeyed. You're getting annoyed.

116.speaker: Lae'zel
116.text: Must you stick out your neck for every dimwit in distress?

234.speaker: Shadowheart
234.text: I'm inclined to agree. Let's not involve ourselves in this place any more than necessary.

264.speaker: Karlach
264.text: I don't like this. What's really going on here?

227.speaker: Astarion
227.text: Let's not make trouble for some stranger. We have our own problems.

11.speaker: Wyll
11.text: The girl's in a fix. It's a hero's duty to step in.

211.text: I'll talk about your wriggler - and that's it. Last warning.
211.context: NodeContext: Annoyed but also happy to forget the whole thing - this doesn't have to get violent

123.speaker: Player
123.text: No. This woman is clearly in trouble.

117.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Ethel waves her hand dismissvely and Mayrina vanishes with a scream

48.text: You want to play the hero so badly? Fine. Let's make this interesting.
48.context: NodeContext: Combat is about to being. You're PISSED. You're about to eviserate the player with your teeth if you have to.

245.speaker: Player
245.text: Fine. Can you remove the parasite?

229.text: Quicker than you can say 'Yes, Auntie.'
229.context: NodeContext: Cheerful and assured - you got this

146.text: What do you say? Want me to take care of the little bugger?
146.context: NodeContext: Sincere offer and said with a smile

138.speaker: Player
138.text: I know a devil that's offered to remove it.

207.text: A devil? Spare me. Blathering windbags in love with the sound of their own voices.
207.context: NodeContext: Rolling your eyes - you cannot believe the player would even consider going to a devil when you're offering to remove it right then and there.

81.text: I'm the safer bet. Plus - you'll get to keep your soul.

163.text: Well, that depends on the job. Removing a parasite is no small feat. But I like you, petal. So I'll only ask for something small...
163.context: NodeContext: Player has asked the cost. Emphasising 'personal' and really musing as if you were just thinking of it (you knew all along but hey you LOVE DRAMA)

198.speaker: Player
198.text: Yes. Get this damn parasite out of me.

114.text: My - I do like them eager. But know that I don't work for free. I expect payment up front...
114.context: NodeContext: Player has jumped at the chance and you're delighted - enjoying having them in your power

171.speaker: Player
171.text: I'll take my chances on my own.

258.text: Hah! Good luck with that. But don't you fret, petal - I'm sure you'll make a very pretty mind flayer.

202.speaker: Player
202.text: Such things are rarely done for free. What's the real bargain here?

98.text: You're a sharp one. I am proposing a deal, but it's different from your little pact. You see, I prefer personal things.
98.context: NodeContext: Pleased that the knows their stuff but being a little dismissive of their 'pact'. You are so much more powerful than some 'pact'

237.text: One of your pretty little peepers.
237.context: NodeContext:  A pause - as if you're considering what to ask. Then gesturing at your own eye. Then the line.

140.speaker: Mayrina
140.text: Oh dear, you don't have one to spare. Terribly sorry, petal - but no deal for you.

199.text: Should you know someone with two eyes in their head and a wriggler problem, send them my way. Auntie will sort them out.

42.text: I'll pluck it from your head, kiss it for luck, then back in it goes. Won't take but a moment.
42.context: NodeContext: Miming the actions gently as if you were giving cooking intructions and not describing removing an eye balls. Very cheerfyl and matter of a fact

169.text: That is my price. Nothing more, nothing less.

94.speaker: Player
94.text: You want one of my eyes? Why?

161.text: I'm afraid that's my business, petal. It's nothing nefarious though - I promise.
161.context: NodeContext: A cheery smile (you would not believe this business woman)

286.text: A touch. But sure you've two eyes in your skull, don't you? No need to be precious.
286.context: NodeContext: Said with a shrug - as if the player is making a big deal out of nothing.

197.text: Glorious. One moment - Auntie needs her real nails for this.
197.context: NodeContext: You about to transform into a massive towering hag with long nails and you're hyping up the drama. Delighted smile - you want to see the player's face.

51.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Ethel dramatically transforms into her true hag form.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: That's a poor bargain. I'll try my luck elsewhere.

88.speaker: Mayrina
88.context: NodeContext: This is the only time you've really called out. You just want water. You wouldn't unless you were deseprate to ask.

159.context: NodeContext: Dismissive gesture, as if shooing a fly as you vanish Mayrina away. Annoyed tone.

241.text: And you - my door is always open, petal. Auntie Ethel is here for you.
241.context: NodeContext: Smile as you turn back to the player.

196.text: As you wish - but should you change your mind, you know where to find me.
196.context: NodeContext: Said with a shurg - you know the player will be back

84.speaker: Player
84.text: This sounds like a spell for a Hag Eye - you want to see through one of my eyes.

279.text: Hah! Not many know that spell. You're close, but not quite right.
279.context: NodeContext: You're surprised and impressed. It's a difficult spell.

25.text: Your eyeball is staying in your head - although it would look delightful on a necklace.

58.text: Ta-ta, petal. Come see Auntie soon.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: I'll find another way to take care of it.

73.text: Yes, because everyone and their mother is an expert on illithid scum.
73.context: NodeContext: Slight roll of your eye at the player being dumb

235.text: I can tell you're almost done cooking. You know you could turn - just like that.
235.context: NodeContext: A knowing tone - still being charming but you think you 'have' the player. You're enticing them to your deal.

273.speaker: Gale
273.text: She's a pregnant lady in distress. We can't just stand by and pretend she's not here.

95.speaker: Player
95.text: Something isn't right. That woman - why is she with you?

218.text: Busybodies are not appreciated around here.
218.context: NodeContext: You're not used to being disobeyed. You're getting annoyed.

7.speaker: Player
7.text: Your brothers are dead - by my hand.

86.speaker: Player
86.text: I gutted your brothers. There was blood everywhere.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: I pray for your forgiveness. I fought your brothers and killed them.

238.text: Hah! You want to play it like that? Fine. Yes, girl - I killed your brothers.
238.context: NodeContext: Player has wrongly accused you of murdering Mayrina's brothers. You are delighted at the ballsy  move - people rarely challenge you like this. You lean into it, really emphasisng the 'I' as you shoot the player a look.

22.speaker: Mayrina
22.text: That can't be true. Auntie Ethel?
22.context: NodeContext: You've just heard Auntie Ethel killed you brothers. You're shocked and failing to register it - turning to her, fully expecting her to deny it.

100.text: They were being rude. And I detest rudeness.
100.context: NodeContext: You're looking Mayrina in the eye and telling her you murdered her brothers. Nochalant voice - like you don't care (you don't)

0.speaker: Mayrina
0.text: You MONSTER. The deal is off!
0.context: NodeContext: You'r hysterical - everyone you love is dead. Collapsing to the ground

278.context: NodeContext: Wave your hand - as if swatting somethign away. Dismissive and cold tone.

134.text: Blessed silence at last. Some time in the cage should do her good.
134.context: NodeContext: Cold and angry - you're pissed

262.text: And you - you'll regret sticking your nose in my business.
262.context: NodeContext: Turns to the player - anger and violence in your eyes. You're going to kill the player - slowly

16.text: Mayrina, my darling, it's not true. No - this scoundrel cut your brothers down. It was awful. So much blood.
16.context: NodeContext: Player has accused you of kill Mayrina's brothers (falsely). You turn to Mayrina in full adoring grandmother act, pleading your innocences as you point at the player in horror - recounting the scene

243.speaker: Mayrina
243.context: NodeContext: You'r hysterical - everyone you love is dead.

110.speaker: Mayrina
110.context: NodeContext: Collapsing to the ground in your grief

24.context: NodeContext: Rolling your eyes as you sigh

121.speaker: Player
121.text: I found your brothers dead outside.

118.text: Yes, your brothers are dead. And before you ask - yes, I killed them.
118.context: NodeContext: Rolling your eyes at Mayrina as you coldly tell her you murdered her brothers. Bored and nonchalant tone.

205.speaker: Astarion
205.text: Well, you heard the lady. We don't want things to get 'messy'.

201.speaker: Wyll
201.text: Spill it. Mayrina deserves the truth.

132.speaker: Gale
132.text: The choice is yours. There's really no good decision to be made here.

139.speaker: Player
139.text: That's Mayrina? Where are her brothers?

147.speaker: Mayrina
147.context: NodeContext: You look up from the table for one of the few times - smiling at the thought of your borhters being near

153.text: They stopped by to pass on their congratulations. Said they'll be waiting for you at home.
153.context: NodeContext: Hurriedly trying to cut off Mayrina from asking any more questions

35.speaker: Mayrina
35.text: Oh. But why didn't they come in to see me?
35.context: NodeContext: Surprised and hurt - you miss them and thought they would have said hello at least

274.text: All they left was a message, which I passed on, didn't I? Don't be stressing.
274.context: NodeContext: Hurriedly trying to cut off Mayrina from asking any more questions

158.text: And you. Hush. Don't be upsetting the girl with such things.
158.context: NodeContext: (to player) A sharp rebuttal (you've actually killed the brothers but don't want Mayrina to know). You're placing the blame on the player to divert the situation.

253.speaker: Player
253.text: Answer the question: where are her brothers?

215.text: You cheeky thing. Sutton Farm. North of Baldur's Gate. Check if you like.
215.context: NodeContext: you rattle it off with the assurance of someone who knows the other won't check your answer

30.text: But I think you have bigger problems.
30.context: NodeContext: Trying to turn the emphasis onto the player - you want to make a deal with the player and distract them from Mayrina.

43.text: Besides, you should save your energy for that wriggler swimming in your brain juice. Fierce inconvenient, isn't it?

249.speaker: Player
249.text: I don't think I'm the one who is upsetting her.

142.text: Then you don't know her like I do. She's getting exactly what she wanted. Don't you fret.
142.context: NodeContext: Said with a knowing smile, you're diverting the player but also can't resist hinting that there is more going on than they know

267.speaker: Player
267.text: We missed out on introductions. Who are you?

182.text: I have many names, petal. But Auntie Ethel will do.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: Interesting place you have, right in the middle of nowhere.

31.text: Beautiful, isn't it? It's my little refuge for the lost and hopeless.
31.context: NodeContext: Gesturing to your home with a smile on your face even as the words are slightly dark

78.speaker: Player
78.text: Did you have any trouble on the way here?

151.text: None that I couldn't handle, precious.
151.context: NodeContext: A grin like more happened than you're telling (spoiler - it did)

165.speaker: Player
165.text: I'm glad you got here safely.

56.text: Thanks to you. You know, you're lucky - you've helped a very powerful lady.
56.context: NodeContext: Full charming granny mode. You are sweet talking the player

150.speaker: Player
150.text: The lady doesn't seem to be enjoying her dinner.

120.context: NodeContext: Trying to turn the emphasis onto the player - you want to make a deal with the player and distract them from Mayrina.

130.speaker: Player
130.text: Do you treat all your guests so poorly?

61.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Shot of Mayrina, wide eyed and afraid, looking from the hag to the player, she's confused and abusedNodeContext: You're shocked the player corrected you. Your expression should be neutral, tense moment as we're not sure how you'll react

13.text: This is why I like you, petal. You say what's on your mind.
13.context: NodeContext: The smile snaps into place - you want the player on your good side (for now)

180.text: I was hoping you'd pay me a visit. You see, I do more than lotions and potions.

67.text: People in dire need travel from all over Faerûn to see little ol' me. And I do my damndest to help them.
67.context: NodeContext: Make yourself sound like mother teresa.

200.text: And you, petal - well, you need a lot of help.
200.context: NodeContext: You're about to reveal you know the player's secret - big 'ol sympathy eyes.

65.context: NodeContext: The smile snaps into place - you want the player on your good side (for now)

36.text: Forgive me if I get a bit sharp. My work wears something awful on me.
36.context: NodeContext: You want the player to feel bad for snapping at you. You're playing the sympathy card.

268.text: You see, I help people from all over Faerûn.
268.context: NodeContext: Make yourself sound like mother teresa.

129.text: Watch that tone, sweetie. You want to be in my good books - trust me.
129.context: NodeContext: You're annoyed - this is the second time the player has stepped on your toes and it's getting tiresome

175.text: That wriggler in your head isn't going to get its damn self out, is it?
175.context: NodeContext: You're annoyed but also convinced you have the player now, that you've won

141.text: Let's start over, shall we? I'm Auntie Ethel.
141.context: NodeContext: The smile snaps into place - you want the player on your good side (for now)

290.speaker: Player
290.text: You said you had something for the parasite?

250.text: Of course! Ah, I'd lose my head if it wasn't attached to me. Now, I must confess - I told a bit of a white lie.
250.context: NodeContext: Said as if you've forgotten why the player is here (you haven't). Said in an apologetic tone

251.text: I said I had something at home that could help. Well, that something...
251.context: NodeContext: Sincere - you want the player on your side

9.text: ...is me. Forgive me - didn't want the grove's prying eyes in my business.

125.text: Shar won't bother us here. She's far too busy writing poetry and crying about how much people prefer her sister.
125.context: NodeContext: You're purposefully poking fun at the player. Smiling as you twist the knife a little.

223.text: Oh, petal. If you think your precious little god holds any power here, you're in for a surprise.
223.context: NodeContext: You're purposefully poking fun at the player. Smiling as you twist the knife a little.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: Tell me, hag: is this intimidation part of the bargaining process? Or does that come after?

145.text: Aw, the wizard thinks they're smart because they can read. How precious.
145.context: NodeContext: Player has refused to apologise. Mocking the player as you twist the knife, enjoying yourself.

244.context: NodeContext: Player has attacked you. You hiss in outrage as you go for the kill.

104.speaker: Mayrina
104.text: If it isn't the cheekiest pup of them all...
104.context: NodeContext: Steel in your voice - you look up and see the player - the person who turned on you. You are NOT impressed.

28.speaker: Mayrina
28.text: Ah, if it isn't my hero! You took ages. Come in - come in!
28.context: NodeContext: Look up and see the player - absolutely delighted. This is the person who 'saved' you.

57.text: There I am in the grove, just trying to make ends meet, and you decide to give me a battering?!

162.text: Who is this? A friend of yours?
162.context: NodeContext: Looks up and see the player. Looks from Mayrina to the player - cautious but not worried. You don't know why the player is.

71.speaker: Mayrina
71.text: No! No, I don't know them.
71.context: NodeContext: Panic. You don't want to get in trouble

87.text: Come now - aren't you going to introduce yourself?
87.context: NodeContext: Slight smile as your turn your sights on the player. You're more cheerful now.

18.text: Oh, I like you - you may stay.
18.context: NodeContext: Full cheerful grandmother - player has been polite and cordial and you like that very much.

203.speaker: Player
203.text: Who I am is not important.

1.text: True. What's important is why you're here - but we can figure that bit out together, petal.
1.context: NodeContext: You sense a business deal and you turn up the charm, settling into the role

190.text: Feel free to relax yourself and have a cuppa, hm?
190.context: NodeContext: Full charming host - like you're welcoming someone into your own home

80.speaker: Player
80.text: I'd rather know who this woman is first.

107.text: Keep your own little nose in your own little dish, petal.
107.context: NodeContext: Said with a forced smile - you don't the player interfering even as you try to maintain a cheerful demeanor

15.context: NodeContext: Said with a smile - you don't expect this to come up again

76.speaker: Player
76.text: Usually people ask what, as opposed to who, I am.

208.text: That's because most people are afraid of their own bloody shadows. Not me, though. Auntie Ethel welcomes everyone.

193.speaker: Player
193.text: Spare me your pleasantries. Are drow even welcome here?

127.speaker: Player
127.text: Nope. Are duergar even welcome here?

192.text: Of course! As if I give a stuffing about what you are. Come in - come in.
192.context: NodeContext: Player has asked if their kind is welcome here. You welcome everyone always.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: How wonderful to meet you! I'm [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53]. It's an absolute pleasure.

91.text: Finally! See, girl? Now that's an introduction.
91.context: NodeContext: Player has dramatically introduced themselves. You use this as an opportunity to be cruel to Mayrina, gesturing at the player as you say 'now that's an introduction'

269.speaker: Player
269.text: I prefer to keep a low profile.

252.text: Cute and secretive? You're too much, petal.
252.context: NodeContext: Turning up the charm as you settle in your grandmother role

219.text: Ah, if it isn't my favourite flower! Welcome to Auntie Ethel's. Come in - come in!
219.context: NodeContext: Big smile as you look up and see the player

113.text: You going to give me one of those precious peepers?
113.context: NodeContext: Point at your own eye - cheery tone

260.text: I'm still waiting for someone with a spare eye...
260.context: NodeContext: Voice trawling off with longing

272.speaker: Player
272.text: What happened to Mayrina? Did you do something to her?

59.text: Here for whatever you need, petal.
